code:
import { createContext } from 'react';
/**
 * Context to store the result of the useEditController() hook.
 *
 * Use the useEditContext() hook to read the context. That's what the Edit components do in react-admin.
 *
 * @example
 *
 * import { useEditController, EditContextProvider } from 'ra-core';
 *
 * const Edit = props => {
 *     const controllerProps = useEditController(props);
 *     return (
 *         <EditContextProvider value={controllerProps}>
 *             ...
 *         </EditContextProvider>
 *     );
 * };
 */

export var EditContext = createContext({
  basePath: null,
  record: null,
  defaultTitle: null,
  loaded: null,
  loading: null,
  onFailureRef: null,
  onSuccessRef: null,
  transformRef: null,
  redirect: null,
  setOnFailure: null,
  setOnSuccess: null,
  setTransform: null,
  refetch: null,
  resource: null,
  save: null,
  saving: null,
  successMessage: null,
  version: null
});
EditContext.displayName = 'EditContext';
